com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter

Class TechnologyAdapterBase.PolledPeerReaderTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.task.ControlledTaskBase
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.TechnologyAdapterBase.PolledPeerReaderTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IControlledTask, ITask, Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    TechnologyAdapterBase

    protected class TechnologyAdapterBase.PolledPeerReaderTask
extends ControlledTaskBase
    A simple peer application reader task which handles the polling of a peer application for messages and their subsequent transformation and firing to FIX.

    This task repeatedly executes the following algorithm in its run() method:

    1. Poll the peer application for messages via IPeerApplicationReader.read(). If no messages exist sleep for the TechnologyAdapterBase.pollingInterval.
    2. For each message read, transform it into a FIX message. On transformation error the message is marked as having an error via IPeerApplicationResultSet.markAsError(java.lang.Object).
    3. Check whether we have already read this message before via IPeerApplicationResultSet.isMarkedAsRead(). If not then mark it as read via IPeerApplicationResultSet.markAsRead(). If so then set the PossResend flag in the message. This protects against sending the same message twice on recovery following a Catalys Server failure while sending the message.
    4. Obtain the appropriate FIX source for this message (default is this message processor) and fire it to FIX.

    Errors encountered on any IPeerApplicationReader calls result in the the reader component being forcibly closed. The task then drops into its recovery mode in which it attempts to open the reader component at the configured recovery interval. Once the reader component is successfully re-opened, normal processing resumes.
